cause.description: The Formosa Foundation is committed to strengthening the ties between the two countries in order to create lasting and mutually beneficial relationships that protect the vital interests of both the United States and Taiwan. Donations to Support Taiwan The Formosa Foundation relies on your financial support to carry out its work. Your donation is tax deductible. To learn more about the Formosa Foundation and what your donation will help fund, please go to: http://www.formosafoundation.org Information About Taiwan Here are links to learn more: http://www.facebook.com/group.php?gid=2204497989 http://www.etaiwannews.com http://www.taipeitimes.com http://www.taiwandc.org http://michaelturton.blogspot.com http://zen.sandiego.edu:8080/Jerome Merchandise to Support Taiwan To order a "I Am Taiwanese American" t-shirt: http://taiwaneseamerican.org/promote.html To order a "Taiwan Independence: Step Off, Biotch" t-shirt: http://www.spicedtee.com/products/Male/3153.htm To order a "Taiwanation" wristband or TW bumper sticker: http://ypg.fapa.org/projects/taiwanation http://ypg.fapa.org/projects/tw_bumper_sticker Other Links of Interest Formosa Foundation on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/group.php?gid=2204686461 Formosa Foundation Ambassador Program: http://formosafoundation.org/ambassador-program/program-description.php The "Formosa Betrayed" movie info page: http://www.facebook.com/group.php?gid=5250182906 http://www.formosathemovie.com/news.php The "Humanity at Stake" book info page: http://www.facebook.com/pages/Abe-Youngs-HUMANITY-AT-STAKE-book-project/18658603055 http://www.humanityatstake.com 1. Taiwan is an independent country and should be rightly recognized as such. 2. Taiwan did not split with the People's Republic of China. It was never part of PRC. 3. The world should denounce China for forcing unification with Taiwan. 4. To ensure its vital interests in Taiwan and long-term stability across the Taiwan Strait, the United States should recognize Taiwan's independence.
